intro: Humboltia aurea, commonly known as the golden thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to coastal environments with sandy soils. Humboltia aurea typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is often found in disturbed areas near the shoreline. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
